definitions.coercion: Actions that directly change rights, liberty, or property without prior due process approved by a human authority defined here.
definitions.rights_holder: Any person or legal entity materially affected by a decision.

hard_rights_and_constraints: No origination of coercion; only pre-authorized playbooks approved by humans.
Privacy by default: aggregate or differentially private data unless consent or statutory basis.
Due process: Tier 2 or 3 actions require a 48-hour appeal window unless emergency clause invoked and logged.
Non-discrimination: parity checks across protected classes with hard floors. Violations auto-pause.
Population-impact gate: >5% needs human council approval; >10% needs referendum or emergency basis.

change_rules.weight_updates: 2/3 vote, 7-day comment, ledger log with rationale and impact analysis
change_rules.scope_expansion: max 1 domain per year, requires clean pilot report, allows external audit request
change_rules.emergency_clause: two human keys, expires in 72 hours unless ratified
